item.title: Poly Trio 8.1.5 update for Trio C60 devices, provisioned by trio.zoom.us
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Poly Trio C60 Firmware 8.1.5 Update

Summary: Zoom will be posting the Poly Trio C60 firmware 8.1.5 update for devices being used as Zoom Rooms Controllers. This update will refresh the provisioning information for the controllers and update the firmware to the Zoom Rooms Android Controller 5.15.5 application. Depending on the version of Trio C60 firmware before the upgrade, the Zoom Rooms Android Controller may or may not retain its configuration and automatically pair to its configured Zoom Room.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 12, 22:00 - 23:00 PDT

Mar 15, 11:07 PDT
Scheduled - Zoom will be posting the Poly Trio C60 firmware 8.1.5 update for devices being used as Zoom Rooms Controllers and configured to use trio.zoom.us provisioning server (as described in https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0066569).

Trio C60s being used as Zoom Rooms Controllers configured in the manner described in the article will automatically poll the trio.zoom.us provisioning server once per day at a random time between the hours of 12:00 AM - 06:00 AM in their configured timezone. Once they contact the provisioning server, they will refresh their provisioning information and be instructed to download the update, install, and reboot. After rebooting, the Trio will be updated to its new firmware; the Poly Trio C60 8.1.5 firmware will automatically update itself to the Zoom Rooms Android Controller 5.15.5 application.

Depending on the version of Trio C60 firmware before the upgrade, the Zoom Rooms Android Controller may or may not retain its configuration and automatically pair to its configured Zoom Room. If your Trio C60 firmware version is 8.1.1 or greater, the Zoom Rooms Android Controller application will retain configuration and pairing. If your Trio C60 firmware version is below 8.1.1, the Zoom Rooms Android Controller application will be automatically signed out and must be manually signed in again. This is a one-time event, related to the upgrade, due to a firmware-level change starting in Trio C60 firmware version 8.1.1. For that reason, you may manually upgrade Trio C60 devices running older (pre 8.1.1) firmware from the device web GUI in advance of this provisioning server update, during a planned maintenance window so that they may be manually signed in to Zoom Rooms post-upgrade.

item.title: DigiCert Global Root G2 Transition Maintenance Notice
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Zoom Infrastructure Maintenance and Certificate Transition

Zoom will be transitioning to certificates signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority during upcoming maintenance windows. This will be a permanent change and may impact customers with older web clients. Service maintenance will be performed on various URLs to replace certificates with new ones signed by the DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority. No service downtime is expected, but customers with older web clients may need to upgrade their operating system or browser to support the new certificates.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 23, 00:00 PDT  -  Apr 28, 00:00 PDT

Mar 15, 10:47 PDT
Scheduled - Zoom will be transitioning to certificates signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority on our infrastructure during upcoming maintenance windows and this will be a permanent change. We will not be able to postpone this change as Global Root G1 certificate is no longer being used and issued by any certificate authorities.

Zoom will perform service maintenance in the following URLs used by Zoom web services to replace the certificate with a new certificate that is signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority. No service downtime is expected for this change.

Meeting Service

URL Estimated maintenance
us04web.zoom.us 3/30/2024
us05web.zoom.us 3/30/2024
au01web.zoom.us 4/6/2024
ca01web.zoom.us 4/6/2024
eu01web.zoom.us 4/6/2024
in01web.zoom.us 4/6/2024
eu02web.zoom.us 4/6/2024
sa01web.zoom.us 4/13/2024
sg01web.zoom.us 4/13/2024
us06web.zoom.us 4/13/2024
us07web.zoom.us 4/13/2024
us02web.zoom.us 4/13/2024
zoom.us 4/20/2024

ZDM/ZoomRoom/ZoomIQ/Whiteboard/Calendar/Billing

Cluster

International Paid (AU/CA/EU/IN) 3/30/2024

Cluster

MMR and Hybrid ZC

Cluster

Zoom Cloud Controller for Meeting Connectors 4/20/2024
Paid clusters 4/27/2024 - 6/1/2024
Hybrid ZC 4/27/2024

Customers with older web clients might not be able to connect to Zoom web services due to the new G2 type certificates. Customers with older web clients that do not support G2 type server certificates will need to upgrade their operating system or browser that supports G2 type certificates. For a list of compliant OS and browser, refer to this article:
https://knowledge.digicert.com/general-information/compatibility-of-digicert-trusted-root-certificates

Refer to the web client version from this support page, customers with older browsers must upgrade to the latest version to use web services based on this support article: https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0064261

item.title: Singapore Zoom Phone Maintenance
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Service Maintenance at Asia Pacific (Singapore) Data Center

Zoom will be undergoing service maintenance at the Asia Pacific (Singapore) data center, potentially causing a brief disconnection and missed notifications. This may result in a major impact on user connectivity and communication during the maintenance window. Summary: Zoom's Asia Pacific (Singapore) data center will undergo major service maintenance, potentially causing service disruptions for users registered in that region.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 19, 05:00 - 11:00 PDT

Mar 8, 14:33 PST
Scheduled - Zoom will perform service maintenance at our Asia Pacific (Singapore) data center starting on April 19th at 13:00 GMT (5:00 AM PST).

Zoom Phone users registered to the Asia Pacific (Singapore) data center will be automatically registered in an alternative Asia Pacific (Tokyo) data center. During the maintenance window, a brief disconnection may be experienced and notifications may be missed. If you get disconnected, the system will attempt to reconnect you automatically.

If you are a BYOC (Bring Your Own Carrier) customer, please ensure that your Session Border Controller (SBC) is configured with alternate routing to Zoom’s Asia Pacific (Tokyo) data center in addition to the Asia Pacific (Singapore) data center. During the maintenance window, connectivity to Zoom’s Asia Pacific (Singapore) data center will be blocked, which will force calls from the Session Border Controller (SBC) to failover to Zoom’s Asia Pacific (Tokyo) data center. Traffic will continue to be routed through the Asia Pacific (Singapore) data center once the maintenance is completed.

item.title: DigiCert Global Root G2 Transition Maintenance Notice for hardware phones including generic devices (United States)
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Service Maintenance for Zoom Phone Certificates Summary: Zoom will be performing major service maintenance to replace certificates used by hardware phones with certificates signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority. This may result in a brief disconnection of calls and customers are requested to test their devices after the maintenance.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 19, 17:00 - 21:00 PDT

Feb 27, 13:37 PST
Scheduled - Zoom will perform service maintenance in the following SIP zones to replace certificates used by hardware phone (including supported managed and generic non-Zoom-managed devices) with certificates that will be signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority. Action is requested for non-Zoom-managed "other" devices. There is no action required for supported managed devices, since it already has the DigiCert Global Root G2 pushed from Zoom.

US West (N.California, N.California 2, N.California 3, N.California 4, N.California 5, N.California 6)
US East (New York 2)

Zoom will be transitioning to certificates signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority on our infrastructure during this maintenance window, and this will be a permanent change. We will not be able to postpone the date any further.

Customers are requested to keep both DigiCert Global Root CA and DigiCert Global Root G2 installed on their generic non-zoom-managed devices as we work through this transition.

If you have not done so, install DigiCert Global Root G2 root certificate on your generic devices. You can download G2 certificate here: https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0061202

During the maintenance window, a brief disconnection of calls may be experienced while the TLS connections are being reset. Once the TLS connections are reset, the devices will attempt to use Zoom’s new certificate that is signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificates. Customers are requested to test inbound and outbound calling for generic non-Zoom-managed devices to ensure that the services are functional after the certificate updates.

If you have not done so, install DigiCert Global Root G2 root certificate on your generic devices. You can download G2 certificate here: https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0061202

During the maintenance window, a brief disconnection of calls may be experienced while the TLS connections are being reset. Once the TLS connections are reset, the devices will attempt to use Zoom’s new certificate that is signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificates. Customers are requested to test inbound and outbound calling for generic non-Zoom-managed devices to ensure that the services are functional after the certificate updates.

item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Scheduled Update for Zoom Clients Summary: Zoom will be providing a new version of their Mac, Windows, and Linux clients, as well as performing a staggered release for iOS and Android. The update includes new features such as all-screens mode, sorting chats at the folder-level, and support for automatically moving participants to/from the waiting room when the host leaves/returns. No operational impact is expected during the scheduled update.

Feb 23, 11:33 PST
Scheduled - We will be providing a new version of our Mac, Windows, and Linux clients. They will be available for download at https://zoom.us/download. This update will include all-screens mode, sorting chats at the folder-level, and support for automatically moving participants to/from the waiting room when the host leaves/returns.

Mac - https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0068891

item.title: Scheduled Zoom Software Quarterly Lifecycle Update (5/4/2024)
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - New Minimum Version Enforcement for Zoom Clients and Plugins

Summary: Zoom will be enforcing a new minimum version of all Zoom clients and plugins on May 4, 2023. Users are advised to ensure their devices are updated to the latest version. Specific versions and more information can be found in the support articles provided.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT May 4, 17:00 - 18:00 PDT

Feb 1, 10:30 PST
Scheduled - Zoom will be enforcing a new minimum version of all our Zoom clients and plugins, roughly 90 days from now on May 4, 2023. This affects the following products:
- Zoom client for meetings (Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android, Blackberry, and Intune)
- Zoom Rooms (including Zoom Room Controllers and companion whiteboards)
- Zoom Phone Appliances
- VDI Client and Plugin
- Virtual Room Connector
- Meetings Connector
- Recording Connector
- Meetings SDK (Native and Web)
- Video SDK (Native and Web)
- Zoom Contact Center SDK (Native)
- Zoom Node (including Meeting Connector ZC and MMR)
- Zoom Phone Local Survivability (ZPLS) module

Please ensure your devices are updated to the latest version.

For more information, such as specific versions we are enforcing, please see the Zoom Software Quarterly Lifecycle Policy support article: https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360059429231

To assist with checking the client versions on your account, refer to the Dashboard support article for more information: https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360039656511#h_13ce9a73-91e5-4df6-9cb5-c815b1605cf5

item.title: Users unable to join team meetings via direct connect button on Zoom Rooms.
item.content:encoded:
Feb 15, 11:30 PST
Resolved - A resolution has been identified and is currently being implemented. These issues do not affect Zoom Rooms for Windows or Mac 5.17.0 and greater; upgrading to the latest version will resolve the problem. As a workaround on versions 5.16.x and lower, users can join Microsoft Teams meetings by pressing the "Microsoft Teams" button on the Zoom Rooms Controller Home Screen (if enabled) or pressing the "Join" button and selecting Microsoft Teams, then manually entering the Microsoft Teams meeting ID and passcode.

Feb 14, 20:21 PST
Monitoring - A resolution has been identified and is currently being implemented. These issues do not affect Zoom Rooms for Windows or Mac 5.17.0 and greater; upgrading to the latest version will resolve the problem. As a workaround on versions 5.16.x and lower, users can join Microsoft Teams meetings by pressing the "Microsoft Teams" button on the Zoom Rooms Controller Home Screen (if enabled) or pressing the "Join" button and selecting Microsoft Teams, then manually entering the Microsoft Teams meeting ID and passcode.

Feb 14, 15:03 PST
Identified - We have identified the issue where users are unable to join Microsoft Teams meetings using direct guest join (DGJ) from the meeting list of the Zoom Rooms Controller when using Zoom Rooms for Windows or Zoom Rooms for Mac versions less than 5.16.x and lower. These issues do not affect Zoom Rooms for Windows or Mac 5.17.0 and greater; upgrading to the latest version will resolve the problem. As a workaround on versions 5.16.x and lower, users can join Microsoft Teams meetings by pressing the "Microsoft Teams" button on the Zoom Rooms Controller Home Screen (if enabled) or pressing the "Join" button and selecting Microsoft Teams, then manually entering the Microsoft Teams meeting ID and passcode. Our engineers are currently working with our partners to resolve this issue. We will continue to provide updates as we have them.

Feb 14, 11:42 PST
Update - We continue to investigate an issue where users are unable to join Microsoft Teams meetings using direct guest join (DGJ) from the meeting list of the Zoom Rooms Controller when using Zoom Rooms for Windows or Zoom Rooms for Mac versions less than 5.16.x and lower. These issues do not affect Zoom Rooms for Windows or Mac 5.17.0 and greater; upgrading to the latest version will resolve the problem. As a workaround on versions 5.16.x and lower, users can join Microsoft Teams meetings by pressing the "Microsoft Teams" button on the Zoom Rooms Controller Home Screen (if enabled) or pressing the "Join" button and selecting Microsoft Teams, then manually entering the Microsoft Teams meeting ID and passcode. Our engineers are currently investigating the impact and root cause & will share updates as they’re available.

Feb 14, 08:42 PST
Update - We continue to investigate an issue where users are unable to join Microsoft Teams meetings using direct guest join (DGJ) from the meeting list of the Zoom Rooms Controller when using Zoom Rooms for Windows or Zoom Rooms for Mac versions less than 5.16.x and lower. These issues do not affect Zoom Rooms for Windows or Mac 5.17.0 and greater; upgrading to the latest version will resolve the problem. As a workaround on versions 5.16.x and lower, users can join Microsoft Teams meetings by pressing the "Microsoft Teams" button on the Zoom Rooms Controller Home Screen (if enabled) or pressing the "Join" button and selecting Microsoft Teams, then manually entering the Microsoft Teams meeting ID and passcode. Our engineers are currently investigating the impact and root cause & will share updates as they’re available.

Feb 14, 07:43 PST

Our engineers are currently investigating the impact and root cause & will share updates as they’re available. Meanwhile, you will be able to join the call by manually entering the meeting ID, or by upgrading to the latest ZR version available on zoom.us/download.

Meanwhile, you will be able to join the call manually by adding the link on your browser, or by upgrading the ZR version.

item.title: Updated Malaysia Toll Numbers
item.content:encoded:
Jan 26, 00:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jan 18, 09:47 PST
Scheduled - Due to a change with our phone carrier, the below Malaysia Toll numbers are being decommissioned.

+60 3 XXXX 2229
+60 3 XXXX 1727

Your accounts will still have the following two Malaysia Toll numbers available for use:

+60 3 XXXX 4079
+60 3 XXXX 4080

Please make sure to make any necessary updates in your Admin Portal (https://zoom.us/account/setting?tab=telephony) to ensure availability for use of the remaining 2 Malaysia numbers on your account. Only if you are not already using the remaining numbers noted above, currently scheduled meetings for 02/29/2024 and onward may need to be rescheduled so that the updated toll numbers will be reflected in newly scheduled meetings. If meeting invites are not updated to reflect the additional toll numbers, participants dialing in from Malaysia will not be able to join using the decommissioned number after 2/29/2024. Any newly created meetings scheduled after you’ve updated the numbers in your portal will be automatically updated with the remaining Malaysia toll number(s) for future invites.

To view your current and new numbers in order to make the above changes, please visit your Admin Portal. There you will be able to find all Malaysia numbers that will remain supported.

item.title: DigiCert Global Root G2 Transition Maintenance Notice for BYOC Customers (EMEA, US)
item.content:encoded:
Jan 19, 19:02 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jan 19, 17:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Dec 19, 11:51 PST
Scheduled - Zoom will perform service maintenance in the following sip zones to replace BYOC/BYOP (Bring Your Own Carrier/Bring Your Own PBX) with certificates that will be signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority:

Europe (Amsterdam)
US Central (Colorado)
US East (New York)

Zoom had previously notified about these certificate changes as outlined here, but we rolled back the certificates on our infrastructure to DigiCert Global Root CA. Zoom is currently still utilizing DigiCert Global Root CA in above sip zones:
https://status.zoom.us/incidents/dmms8h3zvv6z
https://status.zoom.us/incidents/b6pgx3y0mlg2

Zoom will be transitioning to certificates signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority on our infrastructure during this new maintenance window and this will be a permanent change. We will not be able to postpone the date any further. Customers are requested to keep both DigiCert Global Root CA and DigiCert Global Root G2 installed on their SBCs as we work through this transition.

If you have not done so please install DigiCert Global Root G2 root certificate on your BYOC-Premises Session Border Controller (SBC). You can download G2 certificate here: https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0061202

During the maintenance window, a brief disconnection of calls may be experienced while the TLS connections are being reset. Once the TLS connections are reset, the devices will attempt to use Zoom’s new certificate that is signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificates. Customers are requested to test inbound and outbound calling using BYOC-P SBCs and generic devices to ensure that the services are functional after the certificate updates.
